alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 9:54AM PST until February 20 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades, especially above 3000 feet. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow may make travel very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start near 3500 feet Saturday afternoon, lowering to 1500 to 2000 feet by Sunday morning.
info.instruction: There is a potential for significant snow or ice accumulations. Future driving and walking conditions may become hazardous, so it is important to monitor the latest forecasts.
